results.title: Anti-diabetic drug metformin inhibits cell proliferation and tumor growth in gallbladder cancer via G0/G1 cell cycle arrest.
results.text_hl: Till date, there are no reports on the anti-@DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Gallbladder_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005706 @@@gall bladder cancer@@@.

Anti-diabetic drug metformin inhibits cell proliferation and tumor growth in gallbladder cancer via G0/G1 cell cycle arrest. Anticancer Drugs. 2020 Mar;31(3):231-240. PMID: 31815765

results.title: Metformin synergistically enhances antitumor activity of cisplatin in gallbladder cancer via the PI3K/AKT/ERK pathway.
results.text_hl: The results demonstrated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ and Cis inhibited the proliferation of @<m>DISEASE_Gallbladder_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005706 @@@gallbladder cancer@@@ cells, and combination treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ and Cis resulted in a combination index < 1, indicating a synergistic effect.

citations.NLM: Bi T, Zhu A, Yang X, Qiao H, Tang J, Liu Y, Lv R. Metformin synergistically enhances antitumor activity of cisplatin in gallbladder cancer via the PI3K/AKT/ERK pathway. Cytotechnology. 2018 Feb;70(1):439-448. PMID: 29110119

results.title: Metformin suppresses hypoxia-induced migration via the HIF-1alpha/VEGF pathway in gallbladder cancer in vitro and in vivo.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, the role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in cellular migration, and its underlying mechanism in @<m>DISEASE_Gallbladder_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005706 @@@GBC@@@, were also identified.
